intro: Boehmeria chingshuishaniana, commonly known as the Chingshuishan nettle, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes various types of nettles. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles.
